message_1: A company has 5 employees who need to be assigned to 5 different tasks. Each employee can only be assigned to one task, and each task must have exactly one employee assigned to it. In how many ways can the company assign the employees to the tasks?
message_2:
This is a permutation problem. There are 5 employees and 5 tasks, so there are 5! (5 factorial) ways to assign the employees to the tasks.

5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 120

There are 120 ways to assign the employees to the tasks.
